trustfund: TF028932-BANGLADESH HIV/AIDS PREVENTION PROJECT,TF020923-HEALTH AND POPULATION PROGRAM PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Human Immunodeficiency
            Virus/Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (HIV/AIDS)
            Prevention Project aims to assist the Government of
            Bangladesh to prevent the HIV infection from gaining a
            larger foothold within high risk groups and to limit its
            spread into the general population, without stigmatizing the
            high risk groups. This project has four main components. 1)
            High Risk Group Interventions will limit the transmission of
            HIV infection among those populations with the highest
            prevalence of risk behaviors and from those groups to the
            general population. 2) Communications and Advocacy will
            create support for the HIV/AIDS prevention program by i)
            raising awareness, knowledge, and understanding among the
            general population about HIV/AIDS/STDs (sexually transmitted
            diseases); ii) encouraging the mobilization of resources and
            commitment for the implementation of the STD/AIDS Program;
            and iii) reducing stigmatization of HIV/AIDS affected
            people. 3) Blood Safety will facilitate the expansion of
            safe-blood initiatives. 4) Project Support and Institutional
            Strengthening will strengthen the STD/AIDS Program technical
            and managerial capacity with the aim of facilitating the
            rapid scaling up of HIV/AIDS prevention activities; monitor
            the progress of the STD/AIDS Program at large; evaluate the
            impact of these interventions; and conduct research that
            will enhance the impact of the STD/AIDS Program.
